definitions.definition: To communicate with one's voice, to say words out loud.
definitions.example: I was so surprised I couldn't speak.
It's been ages since we've spoken.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To communicate or converse by some means other than orally, such as writing or facial expressions.
To deliver a message to a group; to deliver a speech.
definitions.example: This evening I shall speak on the topic of correct English usage.

definitions.definition: To be able to communicate in a language.

definitions.example: I was so surprised that I couldn't speak a word.

definitions.definition: To communicate (some fact or feeling); to bespeak, to indicate.
(sometimes humorous) To understand (as though it were a language).
definitions.example: So you can program in C. But do you speak C++?

definitions.definition: To produce a sound; to sound.
Of a bird, to be able to vocally reproduce words or phrases from a human language.
To address; to accost; to speak to.
